meanings.definition: To put in danger or jeopardy.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the gate open was imperilling the safety of the animals.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a seatbelt while driving is imperilling your life.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to pack an umbrella on a rainy day imperils your hairdo.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warning signs is like imperilling your own well-being.
meanings.sent5: Playing with fire is imperilling yourself unnecessarily.

meanings.definition: To expose to harm or danger.
meanings.sent1: Leaving toxic chemicals out can imperil the health of your pets.
meanings.sent2: Walking alone in a dangerous neighborhood is imperilling yourself.
meanings.sent3: Eating expired food can imperil your stomach's happiness.
meanings.sent4: Not wearing a helmet while biking is like imperilling your head.
meanings.sent5: Swimming in rough waters is imperilling your safety.
